p: Annual, repeated aerial surveys of whooping cranes have been conducted by USFWS personnel on the wintering grounds between October and May since 1950 (Butler, Strobel, & Eichhorn, 2016; Strobel & Butler, 2014). The survey has been primarily conducted from a fixed‐wing aircraft with transects spaced approximately 250–800 m apart (Butler et al., 2016). The number of surveys conducted each winter between December 1 and March 31 has ranged from 4 to 21 (Butler et al., 2014). This survey produced counts of total winter abundance and number of juvenile birds recruited plus estimates of annual mortality (Butler et al., 2013, 2014).
